description:
At Doist, we specialize in productivity software. We create tools that simplify and organize the workday. It's a modest goal, but an important one. When software tames the chaos and streamlines the little things, it frees you to focus on the big things. Things that amaze. Things that inspire. Things that change the world.

We're a productive, virtual team that makes productivity tools. We are designers, engineers, and communicators united by a common goal, not a common location.

We understand the tools our customers need to succeed in today's workplace, because we need them, too. We build them, share them, and use them to power new ideas, new improvements, and new ways of working.

It's how we've accomplished amazing things, and it's how we help our customers do the same.

Doist's mission is to help people do more each day so they can make the most of their potential.
description_enriched: Doist is a productivity app that brings clarity and efficiency to millions of people and teams. It is the only asynchronous-first collaboration app that encourages teams to focus, create, and disconnect. The company has been pioneering async- and remote-first work for over a decade and is bootstrapped, profitable, and for the long-run.
description_metadata_raw: Doist inspires the workplace of the future by creating simple yet powerful productivity software that promotes a more fulfilling way to work and live.

company_updates.description:
Your best ideas don't arrive in neat bullet points. They're messy, scattered, and often gone before you can write them down.
That friction between a brilliant thought and an actionable task is exactly why we built Ramble in Todoist.

It's the fastest way to get thoughts out of your head and into your project list. Just "ramble" your stream of consciousness‚Äîmeeting notes, project ideas, or a sudden brainwave‚Äîand let Todoist organize it for you.

üöÄ Go from chaotic thought to a clear plan in seconds. 
üó£Ô∏è Capture ideas as fast as you can speak them. 
üß† Finally, a tool that works with your brain, not against it.

Doisters are already getting more done by rambling daily. Have you tried it yet?

Let me know your favorite use case for it in the comments! üëá

#Todoist #Productivity #NewFeature #Ramble #TaskManagement #GettingThingsDone #GTD

company_updates.description:
Had a great conversation with David Rice on the People Managing People podcast about aligning company mission statements with real values and behavior. 

We dove into how Doist moved beyond aspirational values to build systems that actually reinforce our culture and objectives, from feedback loops and performance reviews, to how we communicate internally and align around our core values and mission statement. 

Really enjoyed the chat, thanks for having me on the show, David! 

Links to listen in the comments below üëá

What a week in Thailand for #DoistConnect üôå 

So many great moments and experiences to reflect on - I'll share more about them in the coming days/weeks as feedback comes in and I've had time to process everything. But wow, this was special! 

Thanks to all the amazing teammates who traveled from around the world to make this event a success - so much fun connecting and collaborating with such an incredible group!

Already wondering how we can top this next year, time to get to work üòé

Incredible apps, are built by legendary teams ‚ú® ‚ù§Ô∏è

Managing your to-do list can be a full-time job - mine certainly is. (Sponsored post incoming).

When I started my business, I found it almost impossible to keep on top of my inbox, respond to messages, get through all the boring admin that piled up, and then finally get round to writing or filming videos.

Things would slip through the cracks - I‚Äôd fill in the wrong form, or miss dinner with my friends, or completely forget to record something my team needed from me. My productivity plummeted, as did my wellbeing - I felt like I was drowning in unfinished tasks and missed responsibilities.

So, I knew I had to make a change. And the first step was grappling with my to-do list, which was spiralling out of control. I had reminders on post-it notes, in the notes app in my phone, scribbled down in my diary, or at the bottom of Google Docs. It was a total mess.

So, I decided I wanted to bring together all my tasks and reminders into one place‚Ä¶ and after trying dozens of apps, I landed on Todoist. Total gamechanger. Keeping all of my tasks in one digital space meant that I wasn‚Äôt constantly trying to flick through notebooks to find what I needed. This helped me get a handle on my tasks, and meant that I wasn‚Äôt trying to deal with the mental stress of staying organised while getting things done.

Since then, Todoist has become a key part of my workflow with the team. Now I have an executive assistant - who actually does that full-time job of organising my life - and we can work together with Todoist to quickly and easily get things done. Basically, every time a new task comes up, my assistant adds it to Todoist for me. Perhaps I need to write a social media post by tomorrow - so the task gets added to our shared page with a deadline, so I know to prioritise it.

Or, if I need sign off on something, I can do it right there in the app by responding to any comments or questions without having to jump on a call. If Irem K. (my EA) needs to know if she can go ahead and schedule a podcast interview, or a hang-out sesh with my friends, then I can just answer ‚Äòyep‚Äô asynchronously.

I love that Todoist is built with teams in mind. Keeping my inbox from becoming a complete nightmare isn‚Äôt something I can (or want to) do alone, so I‚Äôm super lucky to have an assistant (on that note, if you can afford it and it‚Äôll be ROI-positive for you, you should hire one too).

With the workflows with Irem (and even for solo projects), Todoist is a key part of my productivity stack. If you‚Äôre looking for a simple, delightful productivity tool that‚Äôll legit help you do more of what matters to you (and hopefully reduce your stress along the way), you might like to check them out üòÅ

Here is a walkthrough of my setup: https://lnkd.in/ev5u_Vcv

We're super-thankful to be recognized ‚Äì in two categories ‚Äì by Remote's 2024 Remote Excellence Awards!

It takes tons of work to make remote work well, and we're thrilled to have the intentional and dedicated team we do, who prove each and every day that culture is more than co-location; it's connection, and needs to be carefully cultivated.

We were especially honored to read the remarks of the judges, who know whereof they speak:

June Bolneo, from WorkRemote:
‚ÄùDoist have been at the forefront of remote working, truly embodying what it means to walk the talk. With years of experience under their belt, they've gained a significant edge in the industry. Jessie de Groot, from Weaviate:
"I love the innovative approach from Doist, they truly embrace the remote-first approach with their async way of working, their documentation approach (employee handbook), and hiring people worldwide. What I like about their talent strategy is their transparency (showing their benefits, people on their website), their perks and benefits designed for distributed teams, and the focus on connections sync and async. Managing your to-do list can be a full-time job - mine certainly is. (Sponsored post incoming).

When I started my business, I found it almost impossible to keep on top of my inbox, respond to messages, get through all the boring admin that piled up, and then finally get round to writing or filming videos.

Things would slip through the cracks - I‚Äôd fill in the wrong form, or miss dinner with my friends, or completely forget to record something my team needed from me. My productivity plummeted, as did my wellbeing - I felt like I was drowning in unfinished tasks and missed responsibilities.

So, I knew I had to make a change. And the first step was grappling with my to-do list, which was spiralling out of control. I had reminders on post-it notes, in the notes app in my phone, scribbled down in my diary, or at the bottom of Google Docs. It was a total mess.

So, I decided I wanted to bring together all my tasks and reminders into one place‚Ä¶ and after trying dozens of apps, I landed on Todoist. Total gamechanger. Keeping all of my tasks in one digital space meant that I wasn‚Äôt constantly trying to flick through notebooks to find what I needed. This helped me get a handle on my tasks, and meant that I wasn‚Äôt trying to deal with the mental stress of staying organised while getting things done.

Since then, Todoist has become a key part of my workflow with the team. Now I have an executive assistant - who actually does that full-time job of organising my life - and we can work together with Todoist to quickly and easily get things done. Basically, every time a new task comes up, my assistant adds it to Todoist for me. Perhaps I need to write a social media post by tomorrow - so the task gets added to our shared page with a deadline, so I know to prioritise it.

Or, if I need sign off on something, I can do it right there in the app by responding to any comments or questions without having to jump on a call. If Irem K. (my EA) needs to know if she can go ahead and schedule a podcast interview, or a hang-out sesh with my friends, then I can just answer ‚Äòyep‚Äô asynchronously.

I love that Todoist is built with teams in mind. Keeping my inbox from becoming a complete nightmare isn‚Äôt something I can (or want to) do alone, so I‚Äôm super lucky to have an assistant (on that note, if you can afford it and it‚Äôll be ROI-positive for you, you should hire one too).

With the workflows with Irem (and even for solo projects), Todoist is a key part of my productivity stack. If you‚Äôre looking for a simple, delightful productivity tool that‚Äôll legit help you do more of what matters to you (and hopefully reduce your stress along the way), you might like to check them out üòÅ

Here is a walkthrough of my setup: https://lnkd.in/ev5u_Vcv

Managing your to-do list can be a full-time job - mine certainly is. (Sponsored post incoming).

When I started my business, I found it almost impossible to keep on top of my inbox, respond to messages, get through all the boring admin that piled up, and then finally get round to writing or filming videos.

Things would slip through the cracks - I‚Äôd fill in the wrong form, or miss dinner with my friends, or completely forget to record something my team needed from me. My productivity plummeted, as did my wellbeing - I felt like I was drowning in unfinished tasks and missed responsibilities.

So, I knew I had to make a change. And the first step was grappling with my to-do list, which was spiralling out of control. I had reminders on post-it notes, in the notes app in my phone, scribbled down in my diary, or at the bottom of Google Docs. It was a total mess.

So, I decided I wanted to bring together all my tasks and reminders into one place‚Ä¶ and after trying dozens of apps, I landed on Todoist. Total gamechanger. Keeping all of my tasks in one digital space meant that I wasn‚Äôt constantly trying to flick through notebooks to find what I needed. This helped me get a handle on my tasks, and meant that I wasn‚Äôt trying to deal with the mental stress of staying organised while getting things done.

Since then, Todoist has become a key part of my workflow with the team. Now I have an executive assistant - who actually does that full-time job of organising my life - and we can work together with Todoist to quickly and easily get things done. Basically, every time a new task comes up, my assistant adds it to Todoist for me. Perhaps I need to write a social media post by tomorrow - so the task gets added to our shared page with a deadline, so I know to prioritise it.

Or, if I need sign off on something, I can do it right there in the app by responding to any comments or questions without having to jump on a call. If Irem K. (my EA) needs to know if she can go ahead and schedule a podcast interview, or a hang-out sesh with my friends, then I can just answer ‚Äòyep‚Äô asynchronously.

I love that Todoist is built with teams in mind. Keeping my inbox from becoming a complete nightmare isn‚Äôt something I can (or want to) do alone, so I‚Äôm super lucky to have an assistant (on that note, if you can afford it and it‚Äôll be ROI-positive for you, you should hire one too).

company_updates.description:
The media narrative around remote work will have its ebbs and flows. 

But for those who aren't distracted by the "return-to-office" moment, and want to explore the diverse benefits of remote work, a guide to the landscape can help.

That's why we're happy to present (and be presented in) Jordan Carroll's must-read book, Remote for Life. Explore the opportunities, embrace the possibilities, and learn from one of remote work leaders. 

Check out the book at https://amzn.to/3UwTe4S or Jordan's website (with tons of free resources): https://lnkd.in/eSkpEUgC

We're super-thankful to be recognized ‚Äì in two categories ‚Äì by Remote's 2024 Remote Excellence Awards!

It takes tons of work to make remote work well, and we're thrilled to have the intentional and dedicated team we do, who prove each and every day that culture is more than co-location; it's connection, and needs to be carefully cultivated.

We were especially honored to read the remarks of the judges, who know whereof they speak:

June Bolneo, from WorkRemote:
‚ÄùDoist have been at the forefront of remote working, truly embodying what it means to walk the talk. With years of experience under their belt, they've gained a significant edge in the industry. What sets them apart is not just their knack for attracting top talent, but their skill in keeping them onboard for the long haul.‚Äù

Jessie de Groot, from Weaviate:
"I love the innovative approach from Doist, they truly embrace the remote-first approach with their async way of working, their documentation approach (employee handbook), and hiring people worldwide. What I like about their talent strategy is their transparency (showing their benefits, people on their website), their perks and benefits designed for distributed teams, and the focus on connections sync and async. I believe all of this is the result of executing a great talent strategy."

Thanks so much for the meaningful words, which will help fuel our team's continuing efforts to make the remote culture at Doist the best it can be. üôè

company_updates.description:
Super excited and honored to join many friends and colleagues at Running Remote in Lisbon next year üáµüáπ 

I'll be speaking on the power of in-person collaboration and how to build a retreat/offsite strategy that supports your distributed team. 

At Doist we're remote-first, empowering our team to work from anywhere. But we also know that building a successful distributed team involves occasionally coming together in the same physical space, to reinforce the connections that support our growth throughout the rest of the year. 

Maximizing the effectiveness of those precious few days together takes an intentional plan and a hefty investment, so I'll dive deep into our IRL strategy, and share some internal details that have driven a consistent 95%+ satisfaction rate with our offsite program. 

And there will be a ton of other great speakers and topics covered for anyone interested in the #futureofwork - I hope you'll join us! 

More info and a 30% discount code available in the comments below, and let me know if you're planning to attend üëá

The media narrative around remote work will have its ebbs and flows. 

But for those who aren't distracted by the "return-to-office" moment, and want to explore the diverse benefits of remote work, a guide to the landscape can help.

That's why we're happy to present (and be presented in) Jordan Carroll's must-read book, Remote for Life. Explore the opportunities, embrace the possibilities, and learn from one of remote work leaders. 

Check out the book at https://amzn.to/3UwTe4S or Jordan's website (with tons of free resources): https://lnkd.in/eSkpEUgC

Big thanks to Ricardo Esteves for this in-depth DesignRush piece on how Doist does remote & async. üôè

Skip the clickbait WFH-RTO drama, and go in-depth on a topic that really matters: 
how to build a culture with values that support remote and async work, like autonomy and communication.

company_updates.description:
Super excited and honored to join many friends and colleagues at Running Remote in Lisbon next year üáµüáπ 

I'll be speaking on the power of in-person collaboration and how to build a retreat/offsite strategy that supports your distributed team. 

At Doist we're remote-first, empowering our team to work from anywhere. But we also know that building a successful distributed team involves occasionally coming together in the same physical space, to reinforce the connections that support our growth throughout the rest of the year. 

Maximizing the effectiveness of those precious few days together takes an intentional plan and a hefty investment, so I'll dive deep into our IRL strategy, and share some internal details that have driven a consistent 95%+ satisfaction rate with our offsite program. 

And there will be a ton of other great speakers and topics covered for anyone interested in the #futureofwork - I hope you'll join us! 

More info and a 30% discount code available in the comments below, and let me know if you're planning to attend üëá

The media narrative around remote work will have its ebbs and flows. 

But for those who aren't distracted by the "return-to-office" moment, and want to explore the diverse benefits of remote work, a guide to the landscape can help.

That's why we're happy to present (and be presented in) Jordan Carroll's must-read book, Remote for Life. Explore the opportunities, embrace the possibilities, and learn from one of remote work leaders. 

Check out the book at https://amzn.to/3UwTe4S or Jordan's website (with tons of free resources): https://lnkd.in/eSkpEUgC

Big thanks to Ricardo Esteves for this in-depth DesignRush piece on how Doist does remote & async. üôè

#management #peopleops #leadership #remotework

Despite the "return to the office" movement, remote and hybrid work models are clearly here to stay in the post-pandemic world. At Toggl, we've been running a remote team for almost a decade (time flies! ‚è≥), and we thought this milestone was the perfect opportunity to reflect on the journey and what we've learned.

But we didn't want to do it alone! We've brought together a range of People Ops leaders and remote work experts to share their insights, experience and advice in our latest expert round-up article.

Huge thanks to Dajana Berisavljeviƒá ƒêakonoviƒá (our very own People Ops pro), Chase Warrington, Alina Jesien, Jessica Z. and Iwo Szapar for contributing their expertise üôè 

Read the full article here üëâ https://lnkd.in/eH9yYJFA

We're super-thankful to be recognized ‚Äì in two categories ‚Äì by Remote's 2024 Remote Excellence Awards!

It takes tons of work to make remote work well, and we're thrilled to have the intentional and dedicated team we do, who prove each and every day that culture is more than co-location; it's connection, and needs to be carefully cultivated.

We were especially honored to read the remarks of the judges, who know whereof they speak:

June Bolneo, from WorkRemote:
‚ÄùDoist have been at the forefront of remote working, truly embodying what it means to walk the talk. With years of experience under their belt, they've gained a significant edge in the industry. What sets them apart is not just their knack for attracting top talent, but their skill in keeping them onboard for the long haul.‚Äù

Jessie de Groot, from Weaviate:
"I love the innovative approach from Doist, they truly embrace the remote-first approach with their async way of working, their documentation approach (employee handbook), and hiring people worldwide. What I like about their talent strategy is their transparency (showing their benefits, people on their website), their perks and benefits designed for distributed teams, and the focus on connections sync and async. I believe all of this is the result of executing a great talent strategy."

Thanks so much for the meaningful words, which will help fuel our team's continuing efforts to make the remote culture at Doist the best it can be. üôè

If you're interested in our intentional approach to modern work, check out this excellent conversation between our own Chase Warrington and Rob Sadow on the #FlexPerspectives podcast... thought-provoking stuff!

description:
Made in Switzerland, the land of watches, banks, and clean design, Smallpdf is an award-winning company that offers a suite of clever document management tools for everyone‚Äîfor work, for home, for life. 

Founded in 2013, Smallpdf provides a simple, secure, and reliable answer to heavy, awkward PDF software. By removing unnecessary features and adding a deep focus on user experience, Smallpdf has become the most-loved and most-trusted PDF software on the planet, serving over 500 million users, 100,000 different companies, in 24 different languages, and in every country in the world.

Smallpdf integrates seamlessly with professional and personal tasks, boosting productivity and simplifying the way people manage their documents, with tools to compress, convert, edit, sign, protect, and unlock PDF documents in just a few easy steps. 

Smallpdf.com is the most-visited website in Switzerland and consistently ranks in the top 300 websites in the world. The Smallpdf team works tirelessly to keep its servers in top shape for its 30+ million monthly users. We believe simple software solutions should be accessible to everyone, which is why our software is affordable, easy to use, and device-agnostic. 

Users can get exclusive, unlimited access by subscribing to Smallpdf Pro, which boasts a host of additional features, like connected tools, batch processing, and offline access via the Smallpdf Desktop App. Businesses are also covered with Smallpdf for Business, which offers all the features of Smallpdf Pro, plus priority support, annual billing, and bulk discounts. 
 
Welcome to Smallpdf, the first and only PDF software you‚Äôll love.

With amazing participants at the meetup last week, we love seeing this vibrant community continuously grow together.

We kicked off the evening with Alex Suzuki‚Äôs personal and honest talk about his journey in tech. No AI, no slides, just real perspective that resonated with many. Samir A. followed with a sharp demo of how Gatling helps simulate production load and catch performance issues before they hit real users.

Not to mention: Nadja R√∏mer Hesselbjerg officially joined us as a co-organizer two weeks ago and kicked ZurichJS into second gear. There‚Äôs a lot of behind-the-scenes work that goes into each event, and she‚Äôs already helping us shape an incredibly bright future for where we‚Äôre headed.

Thanks to Enrique Ruiz Durazo for capturing the night in photos, he‚Äôs got an incridble eye for capturing smiles and the unique energy each event brings out. And a huge shout-out to the new volunteers stepping in to help us build what‚Äôs next.

We‚Äôre already working hard behind the scenes and are close to locking in the rest of this year‚Äôs schedule. We‚Äôre building a space you‚Äôll want to bring your friends and colleagues to, and make new ones while you‚Äôre here.

More to come.

 Are you ready to shape the future of how millions of people work with documents?

At Smallpdf, we're on a mission to make document management simple, powerful, and accessible. With millions of users each month, we‚Äôre looking for a Product Manager who‚Äôs excited to drive real impact‚Äînot just on our ARR, but on the way people and businesses collaborate worldwide.

In this role, you‚Äôll:
 üîç Identify, segment, and target B2C2B and B2B customers
 üß™ Run A/B tests on a massive scale
 üìä Partner with engineers, data scientists, designers, and researchers
 üåç Expand our B2B footprint while keeping our B2C experience delightfully simple

This isn‚Äôt just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a chance to shape strategy, lead with data, and grow in an environment that values curiosity and experimentation.

üíº Location: Zurich, Switzerland
 üì© Sound like you or someone you know? Let‚Äôs talk! Apply now or share this with a future teammate.

 #Hiring #ProductManagement #ZurichJobs #B2B #TechCareers #Smallpdf

Happy New Year From Smallpdf! 

As we‚Äôre kicking off 2025, we‚Äôre reflecting on an amazing year of helping millions of you simplify your work. We‚Äôre filled with gratitude for the opportunities, challenges, learnings and successes of the past year. None of it would have been possible without the support of our incredible team, users, partners and community. We topped the year off by celebrating together in Zurich during our annual Christmas event!

Some fun facts, in 2024:
‚≠ê¬†We processed 800 million documents (read that again!).
‚≠ê¬†We launched our new venture ‚ÄòSign.com‚Äô.
‚≠ê¬†We welcomed 26 new faces in the Smallpdf group.
‚≠ê¬†Our team(s) connected over 70 times in real life with team buildings, happiness events, rituals and company days.
‚≠ê¬†We got ISO27001 re-certified!

In 2025, we want to do even better. We‚Äôre excited to grow, innovate and make an even greater impact together by bringing you even more powerful features and improved experiences. Our mission remains the same: making working with PDFs simple, accessible, and efficient for everyone.
From all of us at Smallpdf, we wish you a fulfilling 2025 filled with success, productivity, collaboration and new possibilities. Here‚Äôs to setting bold goals and achieving them! ü•Ç

Introducing a new ritual at Smallpdf! ü§ó 

Every last Thursday of the month, we step away from our desks and dive into adventures together. Whether sailing on the water, battling it out in board games, or exploring nature on a hike, these moments help us bond, refresh, and return to work with renewed energy. 

Grateful for a team that values both work and play! üåäüé≤‚õ∞Ô∏è

From startups to enterprises, businesses are switching to Smallpdf for smarter document management.

Why? Each has their own reason. Find yours ‚Äî with a ùüï-ùêùùêöùê≤ ùêüùê´ùêûùêû ùê≠ùê´ùê¢ùêöùê• üëâ https://lnkd.in/dqZ4CK4N

Get full access to all our PDF tools, no strings attached.

Fresh out of the product oven: OneDrive integration is here!

You can now open files directly from your OneDrive, process them in Smallpdf, and save them right back ‚Äî no uploads, no downloads.

This was one of our most requested features ‚Äî especially by our business customers. We‚Äôre excited to deliver it, and yes, we‚Äôre already building what‚Äôs next.

Stay tuned!

#ProductUpdate #CustomerDriven
As always, the pleasure was all ours. Rumor has it that ZurichJS is already gearing up for the next meetup üëå Our doors are always open to you!
company_updates.reshared_post_description:
ùêôùêÆùê´ùê¢ùêúùê°ùêâùêí ùê¢ùê¨ ùê†ùê´ùê®ùê∞ùê¢ùêßùê† ùêöùêßùêù ùê≠ùê°ùê´ùê¢ùêØùê¢ùêßùê†!

With amazing participants at the meetup last week, we love seeing this vibrant community continuously grow together.

We kicked off the evening with Alex Suzuki‚Äôs personal and honest talk about his journey in tech. No AI, no slides, just real perspective that resonated with many. Samir A. followed with a sharp demo of how Gatling helps simulate production load and catch performance issues before they hit real users.

As always, it was great to connect with so many of you. These meetups are all about devs connecting with devs. We also shared updates on the ZurichJS platform, rolled out exclusive community discounts, and gave a peek at what‚Äôs coming next.

Not to mention: Nadja R√∏mer Hesselbjerg officially joined us as a co-organizer two weeks ago and kicked ZurichJS into second gear. There‚Äôs a lot of behind-the-scenes work that goes into each event, and she‚Äôs already helping us shape an incredibly bright future for where we‚Äôre headed.

Thanks to Enrique Ruiz Durazo for capturing the night in photos, he‚Äôs got an incridble eye for capturing smiles and the unique energy each event brings out. And a huge shout-out to the new volunteers stepping in to help us build what‚Äôs next.

We‚Äôre already working hard behind the scenes and are close to locking in the rest of this year‚Äôs schedule. The feedback lately has been incredible, and we‚Äôve got some world-class speakers and open source contributors lined up. We‚Äôre building a space you‚Äôll want to bring your friends and colleagues to, and make new ones while you‚Äôre here.

And finally, big thanks to Smallpdf for sponsoring and everyone who supports us through Buy Me a Coffee. You help keep this all running ‚ù§Ô∏è

More to come.

Links in the comments üëá

#ZurichJS #JavaScriptCommunity #FrontendDev #MeetupRecap #WebDevelopment #ZurichTech

In an AI-driven world, are you building the next big thing solo? Or scaling an app that feels like it's facing an army of users?

With just over a week left until our 5th edition of Zurich JS, now's the time to RSVP and connect with fellow builders!
Join us for an evening at Smallpdf awesome space in Zurich, complete with networking, delicious pizza, and insightful conversations.

We'll hear from Alex Suzuki on "Carving your own path: a builder's journey", sharing real-life lessons for aspiring and current solopreneurs. 
And Samir A. will guide us through "Load Testing with Confidence: Integration of load tests in CI/CD," crucial for ensuring your applications can handle any surge.

company_updates.description:
üéâ Join us in welcoming the new Pdftools CEO, Simon Sardoschau, who will take over the leadership baton from Tommy Gruederich on June 17th. 

A big THANK YOU to Tommy for his instrumental role in transforming Pdftools from a technology company into a SaaS enterprise while overseeing strong topline growth and redefining the company‚Äôs culture, mission, values, and employee value proposition in parallel. Great job!

And welcome, Simon! The team is already looking forward to seeing you leverage your experience, strategic mind, and execution power to guide us toward continued growth and continuously better products for our customers!

üéí From volcanic peaks to desert dunes, our company backpack keeps exploring! 

This time, Monika Auguscik is taking us to Dune 45 in the stunning Namib Desert, Namibia. üåµ

‚ú® Ready to carve your own path with us? Check out our open positions üëâ  https://lnkd.in/eZfSB78a

üö® HIRING ALERT! üö®

üåü Ready to collaborate with top-notch designers and developers to craft exceptional user experiences? As our Staff Software Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in ensuring our products meet user expectations and contribute effectively to our strategy. With our platforms used by millions daily, your contributions will directly impact the lives of our users.

Your responsibilities will include:

üíª Partnering with the Product Manager to align user needs with technical implementation
üíª Bringing improvements to our platforms by implementing new features and polishing existing ones
üíª Working closely with other engineers to challenge ideas and brainstorm for the best solutions
üíª Collaborating with data scientists to ensure our work is statistically significant and impactful

Join us and unlock opportunities for growth, personal and professional development, and a generous vacation policy. Let's innovate together! üöÄ

Adventure takes us to new heights! üåã


Our company backpack reached near Mount Etna's summit in Sicily at around 3000 meters above sea level. Though Alexandru's visit was cut short by volcanic activity, the thrill of exploration remains!

Ready for your next career adventure? Check out our open positions and reach new peaks with us! üéí

https://lnkd.in/eZfSB78a

description:
Atomic Object helps companies innovate and grow with custom software that‚Äôs beautiful, reliable, and easy to use. We work with executives to improve their bottom line by delivering new products, enhancing existing products, modernizing legacy products, and integrating AI into their software systems. 

Our team of designers and developers can bring your idea to life ‚Äî from planning to implementation. We‚Äôll help you mitigate risk, make smart trade-offs, and get the most value possible for your budget. 

From our offices in Grand Rapids, Chicago, Raleigh-Durham, and Ann Arbor, we serve a national base of clients ‚Äî from startups to the Fortune 500. Whatever your market, we'll help you out-compete with software created with your business outcomes in mind. 

Employee-owned; since 2001.

Coffee, community, and AI‚Äîtogether in one space.

Our GR Managing Partner, Jason Porritt, joined the Shelley Irwin Show on WGVU to share details about our upcoming Collider + AI Garage‚Äîa free, drop-in morning of conversation and hands-on AI demos at our Grand Rapids office.

Join us September 16 during Tech Week Grand Rapids. Swing by for ten minutes or stay an hour‚Äîyou‚Äôll leave with caffeine and new ideas.

üéüÔ∏è  Snag your FREE ticket via the link in comments.

https://lnkd.in/gNCEmQCq

This is one of my favorite things to see happening in our office at Atomic Object.

It isn't a staged photo. I warned the team I was going to play David Attenborough and grab a photo the next time I walked by while "class" was in session. Dre Solorzano taking point to get the team aligned on a domain model decision.

In-person collaboration is still one of the best tools for teams who are solving challenging problems in complex domains. Our client for this project has been disappointed by other partners in the past. This team's visible progress is a stark difference and I credit this environment as a significant factor in their success. That's on top of each of these teammates being amazingly smart, motivated, and caring deeply about our client's goals.

Keep up the good work, team!

There‚Äôs real energy in the Raleigh tech community, and we felt it this week! ‚ö° 

We had a blast hosting North Carolina Technology Association (NC TECH)'s Brews & Bytes event at our Raleigh office last night. 

Ryan Abel, Taylor Vanden Hoek, and the rest of our team loved swapping stories, sharing ideas, and meeting other folks who care about building great tech and a strong NC community around it. Big thanks to NC TECH for putting this together

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
What it means to be a great Designer is changing for Product Designers, Researchers, Design Strategists, Illustrators, you name it. 

I‚Äôve been curious about how others are meeting the moment from the c-suite perspective, the specialist viewpoint, and the owner/operator lens. 

- How are their expectations of a great design leader evolving?¬†
- What‚Äôs helping them stay on top of the game?¬†
- What opportunities does this open up for experienced pros vs emerging talent?

We‚Äôre making this üëÜ conversation public on September 9th at Duke University. Join me, Marc Gagnon, Gretchen McNeely, and Amanda Stockwell as we delve into the topic of Designing Through Change. Registration link in the comments!

#productdesign #designleader #designstrategy

company_updates.description:
Celebrating¬†Valerie Nielson, one of our newest Accelerators in Ann Arbor!

Last week, Valerie presented her undergraduate research study, ‚ÄúMitigating Ransomware Attacks in Healthcare Mobile Apps,‚Äù at the 2025 International Conference on Security & Management. The work shows how combining encryption, integrity checks, and iterative threat analysis on Android apps safeguards health data.

‚ÄúGiven that sensitive health data in mHealth apps can be life-critical, strengthening confidentiality, integrity, and availability is absolutely essential,‚Äù she said.

Her paper will be published by Springer Nature, so Valerie's research will soon reach a global audience.

üëè Join us in congratulating Valerie on this achievement!

We opened our Ann Arbor office back in 2013. Twelve years later, that decision has grown into a 50-person team, 57 local clients, and more than 90 custom software products that power startups, nonprofits, and Fortune 500s alike. 

In Purpose Jobs‚Äô latest feature, Managing Partner Jonah Bailey explains how our structure shapes every decision:

‚ÄúBeing privately held and 100 percent employee-owned gives us the freedom to grow in ways that align with our values and support our people.‚Äù

That mindset helped us weather the pandemic and market swings, enabling us to¬†run programs such as¬†the two-year Accelerator and the Baker & Cook Fellowship,¬†which open doors for emerging developers in our local community.

And we have to thank Ann Arbor SPARK for supporting local companies like ours from the start!

Celebrating¬†Valerie Nielson, one of our newest Accelerators in Ann Arbor!

Last week, Valerie presented her undergraduate research study, ‚ÄúMitigating Ransomware Attacks in Healthcare Mobile Apps,‚Äù at the 2025 International Conference on Security & Management. The work shows how combining encryption, integrity checks, and iterative threat analysis on Android apps safeguards health data.

‚ÄúGiven that sensitive health data in mHealth apps can be life-critical, strengthening confidentiality, integrity, and availability is absolutely essential,‚Äù she said.

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
Last week marked 9 year AO-versary at Atomic Object, and I couldn‚Äôt be more grateful.

Over nearly a decade, I‚Äôve had the opportunity to collaborate with dozens of clients across a wide range of industries‚Äîfrom startups to nonprofits to enterprise organizations. Each project has been a new challenge, a new domain to understand, and a chance to build something meaningful.

What makes it all so rewarding? The people.
At Atomic, I‚Äôve been surrounded by some of the smartest, most thoughtful, and generous teammates you could hope for. Developers, designers, and delivery leads all working shoulder to shoulder to help our clients move faster, make smarter decisions, and build software that scales with their ambitions.

I‚Äôve learned so much by being part of this crew: how to think through tough problems, how to collaborate better, how to lead with curiosity, and most of all, how to build great products while having a lot of fun doing it. Here's to many more years!

Also, shout out to Kimberly Crawford and Alecia Frederick for this "monster" of a cake to celebrate!

Last week, Atomic‚Äôs Chicago office drew a sold-out crowd for ‚ÄúBuilding with AI Agents,‚Äù an evening of learning, connection, and hands-on exploration of today‚Äôs AI tools.

Our Managing Partner,¬†Jordan Schaenzle, and Software Developer and Consultant Vladimir Surganov, shared their expertise during the panel discussion. The audience also saw a live demo of Replit and joined lively conversations on approaches ranging from coding-assistant agents like Cursor to ‚Äúvibe coding‚Äù with AI.

Big thanks to 1871 for making space for these conversations; it was clear that everyone was eager to go deeper and explore what‚Äôs possible with #GenAI.

What a joy to welcome clients, partners, and community leaders to our new Ann Arbor office last week.

Highlights included a conversation between Managing Partner Jonah Bailey and Lt. Gov. Garlin Gilchrist II on how Southeast Michigan‚Äôs tech sector, emerging talent, and public leadership can work together to fuel regional economic growth... and a periodic table cake!

Thank you to everyone who joined us. We're excited to continue building strong relationships and valuable software as we expand into our new space.

Last week, our Raleigh Managing Partner, Ryan Abel, and Delivery Lead, Chris Johnson, joined regional tech leaders for a full day of learning and connection. Thanks to the folks at GrepBeat for putting on such a thoughtful event. 

We're grateful to be part of this vibrant, growing community. Until next year!

üé• What Leaders Need to Know: AI Powered Coding in 2025

Join us for a dynamic conversation and live coding session exploring how AI is transforming product development. Inspired by Ron Jeffries‚Äô classic approach to demoing extreme programming practices, we‚Äôll test how far modern AI tools can go ‚Äî from writing basic functions to building an entire bowling scoring app live.

Mike, Jonah, and Drew will unpack what still matters in quality software engineering practice, how AI shifts team dynamics, and whether today‚Äôs AI tools can deliver production-ready software. With real-time demos and strategic takeaways, we'll show how AI is lowering the cost of custom software and opening the doors to new opportunities for teams and clients.

üìÖ Don‚Äôt miss it ‚Äî follow and set a reminder to join us live!

Fri, Apr 25, 2025, 12:30 PM - 1:00 PM ET

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
I'm filled with gratitude to Atomic Object for hosting People of Color Code's first in-person meetup in 3 years. The space was perfect for our discussions about AI, web development, and open source.

As someone who's been attending Code & Chill since 2019, I'm amazed and proud to see how our community has evolved. This gathering was particularly special for me as my first in-person event as an organizer, and it marks an important milestone as our first meeting since becoming a 501(c)(3) nonprofit!

A heartfelt thank you to Byron Woodfork and Oscar Delgadillo, our incredible founding organizers, for welcoming me onto the organizing team. And, of course, thank you to everyone who came out to code and chill with us!

Looking forward to many more gatherings where we can connect, create, and support each other.

#PeopleOfColorCode #TechCommunity #CodeAndChill #NonprofitTech

"Women and diversity in general are good for tech. The products we build need to reflect diverse perspectives. That leads to more creativity and better solutions that work for more people, not just the dominant group," said Brittany Hunter, our Delivery Practice Lead in Grand Rapids.

That belief is part of what led Brittany to help organize this year's Go Beyond conference, a grassroots event designed to connect and elevate women in tech.

Atomic was proud to serve as the premier sponsor, and Brittany brought a dozen women from our team to be part of the experience. Why? Because showing up for your tech community means more than writing code. It means fostering community as intentionally as we build software.

Check out the link in the comments to hear how Brittany and others are creating space for women in tech to thrive.

company_updates.reshared_post_description:
üéß Attention MeetHER fans! Get ready for an electrifying episode! üí•

In this inspiring episode of MeetHER, we dive into the world of tech and empowerment with Brittany Hunter, Delivery Practice Lead at Atomic Object. From a young age, Brittany was captivated by the power of computers as a storytelling tool. As a youth, she discovered her passion for technology by building websites‚Äînot just as a technical exercise, but as a creative platform to help people share their most meaningful stories.

This innate desire to amplify voices through technology set the stage for Brittany's remarkable journey in tech. A true maker at heart, she has always seen computers as more than just machines, but as powerful instruments of connection and expression. 

Today, as a Delivery Practice Lead at Atomic, Brittany continues to champion this vision. When she's not horseback riding or exploring her diverse interests, she's working to create inclusive spaces in technology. She opens up about Atomic's Accelerator Program, a groundbreaking initiative designed to build a culture of belonging at Atomic and in the tech industry.

Brittany candidly discusses the challenges women face in technology, including the often-debilitating imposter syndrome and stereotype threat, offering powerful insights on overcoming these barriers. She highlights local organizations like STEM Greenhouse and Girls That Code that are making significant strides in tech diversity.

Inspired by Kelly Barnhill's thought-provoking book When Women Were Dragons, this episode is a testament to how a young person's passion for technology can grow into a powerful force for storytelling, connection, and change.

Listen Here - üëâ https://lnkd.in/ghiDn2wQ
